meanings.sent1: The toast will popout of the toaster when it's ready.
meanings.sent2: I saw a squirrel popout from behind the tree.
meanings.sent3: The surprise gift will popout of the box when she opens it.
meanings.sent4: The answer seemed to popout of nowhere in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The jack-in-the-box made the clown popout with a spring.

meanings.definition: A sudden or unexpected appearance or occurrence.
meanings.sent1: The popout of the sun after the storm was beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The popout of the rabbit from the hat amazed the audience.
meanings.sent3: The popout of the clown at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The popout of the idea in her mind was like a light bulb turning on.
meanings.sent5: The popout of the shooting star was a magical moment.

meanings.definition: A detachable or removable part of something, such as a window or menu.
meanings.sent1: The popout on the computer screen allowed me to access more options.
meanings.sent2: The popout on the book cover revealed a hidden message.
meanings.sent3: The popout on the car door made it easier to clean inside.
meanings.sent4: The popout on the website menu simplified navigation.
meanings.sent5: The popout on the map showed additional details of the area.
